channel.title: Get rid of acne in a few hours (Takes a few days to become perfect)
channel.description:
[b]This is common sense! And it [i]will[/i] hurt! But the pain isn't much and it's worth it![/b]
Alright. I used to have acne, and I found this out myself, and it works (Ask Zammyking111)! However, you have to be able to tolerate a stinging pain for a while... And I recommend only doing a small portion of your acne a time, so that way, a huge part of you won't burn.
[b]You Need: [/b]Soap, a rag/cloth (Better if it's rough), and water.
[b]Step One: [/b]Wash your face with soap.
[b]Step Two: [/b]Take a cloth/rag and flood it with soap and rub it together until it doesn't unfold when you let go of it.
[b]Step Three: [/b]Rub the cloth/rag thoroughly where your acne is, and after a few minutes, move it. Keep doing this until you have gotten every spot of your acne for atleast two minutes.
[b]Why It Works: [/b]The rug/cloth should tear the top layer of your skin, and wash out all the bacteria in your acne and clean you up!
Like I said, only do a small part because you don't want a huge part of you hurting at once!
Times..
[b]An hour after this treatment: [/b]Your skin will be a red color and will sting if you touch it.
[b]The next day, or many hours later: [/b]There will be dry skin where you rubbed
[b]Day three: [/b]It will become unnoticeable, but you will still feel the dry skin.
[b]Day four: [/b]Most likely your skin will be fine and you're acne free!
[b]Does this make you an emo for causing pain to yourself purposely?[/b] IMO, no :P
Hope I helped you!
~Lin

item.title: Get rid of acne in a few hours (Takes a few days to become perfect)
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I used to do this, but its with a face cream sort of moisturising cream that had sand in it, which eventually rubbed your old skin off to leave new skin.

Although most of my acne has gone now that i dont eat so much greasy food.

You gotta remember if you eat greasy food and do this, after you’ve done it the acne will just come back after a few days. Just stick to eating non greasy food after you’ve done this.

Also this can scar your face slightly if done to rough. (Not badly scar but just leave small crators of skin).

Aftermath:

I puncture pimples and drain them, then clean up with water.

fuck yes do i love doing this.

Read full topic
item.source: Get rid of acne in a few hours (Takes a few days to become perfect)

item.title: Get rid of acne in a few hours (Takes a few days to become perfect)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

This is common sense! And it will hurt! But the pain isn’t much and it’s worth it!

Alright. I used to have acne, and I found this out myself, and it works (Ask Zammyking111)! However, you have to be able to tolerate a stinging pain for a while… And I recommend only doing a small portion of your acne a time, so that way, a huge part of you won’t burn.

You Need: Soap, a rag/cloth (Better if it’s rough), and water.

Step One: Wash your face with soap.

Step Two: Take a cloth/rag and flood it with soap and rub it together until it doesn’t unfold when you let go of it.

Step Three: Rub the cloth/rag thoroughly where your acne is, and after a few minutes, move it. Keep doing this until you have gotten every spot of your acne for atleast two minutes.

Why It Works: The rug/cloth should tear the top layer of your skin, and wash out all the bacteria in your acne and clean you up!

Like I said, only do a small part because you don’t want a huge part of you hurting at once!

Times…

An hour after this treatment: Your skin will be a red color and will sting if you touch it.

The next day, or many hours later: There will be dry skin where you rubbed

Day three: It will become unnoticeable, but you will still feel the dry skin.

Day four: Most likely your skin will be fine and you’re acne free!

Does this make you an emo for causing pain to yourself purposely? IMO, no

Hope I helped you!

~Lin
